feature.name: Divine Domain: Snack Domain (HB)
feature.text:
Clerics of the Snack Domain understand the divine truth hidden within every morsel of food. They believe in the sanctity of snacking, preaching the gospel of gastronomic joy, and wielding divine power to ensure everyone can appreciate the holy splendour of snacks. Their pantheon includes deities of harvest, festivity, and indulgence, who teach that enlightenment can be found in the joy of shared meals and the simple pleasure of a perfectly crafted snack.
Domain Spells: At each indicated cleric level, add the listed spells to your spells prepared. They do not count towards your limit.
Snack Domain Spells: Cleric Level | Spells 1st | goodberry, unseen servant 3rd | enlarge/reduce, dragon's breath 5th | fly, Leomund's tiny hut 7th | fabricate, charm monster 9th | dream, teleportation circle
Source: Subclasses That Shouldn't Exist v1 p. 8 (Homebrew)

feature.name: Heavenly Hospitality (Snack Domain (HB))
feature.text:
At 1st level, you learn the Prestidigitation cantrip, which doesn't count against the number of cleric cantrips you know. In addition, you gain proficiency with cook's utensils.
Source: Subclasses That Shouldn't Exist v1 p. 8 (Homebrew)

feature.name: Divine Seasoning (Snack Domain (HB))
feature.text:
Starting at 1st level, as a reaction when you see someone within 30 feet of you receive healing or temporary hit points, you can grant additional healing or temporary hit points equal to your Wisdom modifier. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (a minimum of once). You regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.
Source: Subclasses That Shouldn't Exist v1 p. 8 (Homebrew)

feature.name: Channel Divinity (Snack Domain (HB))
feature.text:
At 2nd level, you can use your Channel Divinity to conjure a modest meal that revitalizes your allies. As an action, you present your holy symbol and create food to restore a number of hit points equal to 5 times your cleric level divided among any creatures of your choice within 30 feet. This food disappears after 1 minute if uneaten, and consuming it requires an action. Additionally, those who partake gain advantage on saving throws against being poisoned for the next 8 hours.
Source: Subclasses That Shouldn't Exist v1 p. 8 (Homebrew)

feature.name: Sugar Rush (Snack Domain (HB))
feature.text:
Starting at 6th level, you can invigorate your allies with a divine burst of energy. As a bonus action, you grant you or an ally within 30 feet Sugar Rush. For 1 minute, the affected ally gains an additional 10 feet to their movement speed and can take one additional bonus action on each of their turns. This bonus action can only be used to take the Dash, Disengage, Hide or Use an Object action. This feature can be used a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (a minimum of once), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.
Source: Subclasses That Shouldn't Exist v1 p. 8 (Homebrew)

feature.name: Potent Nourishment (Snack Domain (HB))
feature.text:
Beginning at 8th level, you add your Wisdom modifier to the damage you deal with any cleric cantrip.
Source: Subclasses That Shouldn't Exist v1 p. 8 (Homebrew)

feature.name: Eternal Snack Pack (Snack Domain (HB))
feature.text:
At 17th level, you gain access to an inexhaustible supply of divine snacks. As a bonus action, you can summon the Eternal Snack Pack, a magical container that floats near you and remains for 1 minute. While the Snack Pack is present, you and any ally within 5 feet can reach into the pack as a bonus action to grab a snack, gaining temporary hit points equal to your cleric level and removing one condition of the consumer's choice (blinded, deafened, paralyzed or poisoned). After you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.
Source: Subclasses That Shouldn't Exist v1 p. 8 (Homebrew)
